TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed TYPEFLAGS extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the properties and attributes of a type description.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For additional information about `TYPEFLAGS`, see the MSDN Library.
The common language runtime throws an exception when a COM method in native code returns an HRESULT. For more information, see [How to: Map HRESULTs and Exceptions](../Topic/How%20to:%20Map%20HRESULTs%20and%20Exceptions.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FAGGREGATABLE = int16(1024)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FAPPOBJECT = int16(1)

Docs.summary: A type description that describes an object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FCANCREATE = int16(2)

Docs.summary: Instances of the type can be created by .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FCONTROL = int16(32)

Docs.summary: The type is a control from which other types will be derived and should not be displayed to users.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FDISPATCHABLE = int16(4096)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the interface derives from , either directly or indirectly. This flag is computed; there is no Object Description Language for the flag.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FDUAL = int16(64)

Docs.summary: The interface supplies both and VTBL binding.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FHIDDEN = int16(16)

Docs.summary: The type should not be displayed to browsers.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FLICENSED = int16(4)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FNONEXTENSIBLE = int16(128)

Docs.summary: The interface cannot add members at run time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FOLEAUTOMATION = int16(256)

Docs.summary: The types used in the interface are fully compatible with Automation, including VTBL binding support. Setting dual on an interface sets both this flag and the . This flag is not allowed on dispinterfaces.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FPREDECLID = int16(8)

Docs.summary: The type is predefined. The client application should automatically create a single instance of the object that has this attribute. The name of the variable that points to the object is the same as the class name of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FPROXY = int16(16384)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the interface will be using a proxy/stub dynamic link library. This flag specifies that the type library proxy should not be unregistered when the type library is unregistered.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FREPLACEABLE = int16(2048)

Docs.summary: The object supports , and has default behaviors.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FRESTRICTED = int16(512)

Docs.summary: Should not be accessible from macro languages. This flag is intended for system-level types or types that type browsers should not display.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS TYPEFLAG_FREVERSEBIND = int16(8192)

Docs.summary: Indicates base interfaces should be checked for name resolution before checking children, which is the reverse of the default behavior.
